intro: Emerus alpestris, commonly known as the alpine emerus, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Emerus alpestris is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is a symbol of mountainous ecosystems.
